metadata.name: New Firewall Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows firewall via netsh

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' firewall ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' add ')) AND NOT (lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*advfirewall firewall add rule name=dropbox dir=in action=allow "program=.:\\\\program files (x86)\\\\dropbox\\\\client\\\\dropbox\\.exe" enable=yes profile=any.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*advfirewall firewall add rule name=dropbox dir=in action=allow "program=.:\\\\program files\\\\dropbox\\\\client\\\\dropbox\\.exe" enable=yes profile=any.*'))

output.summary: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows firewall via netsh

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate administration activity 2. Software installations Reference: https://web.archive.org/web/20190508165435/https://www.operationblockbuster.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Operation-Blockbuster-RAT-and-Staging-Report.pdf
